rComments: He was given the class on short notice, but even giving him that credit as a teacher he was unhelpful.  He did not know how to hold the class's attention and wouldn't do thorough example problems.  This made it really difficult for those of us not adept at physics.  Overall seemed like a nice guy but lacked in the teaching department.

He would be great if he had been given enough time to prepare for this class. He is great at helping students and he's approachable. He makes physics interesting (cool demos). Joe's intelligent and has a lot of potential for upcoming quarters. Everyone complains, but its because they are used to the bar being lowered for bio majors.
